intro: Polygala angustifolia var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the Polygalaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often branched stems and small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pale pink. The leaves are narrow to broadly ovate, giving the plant its varietal name, and they are usually arranged alternately along the stem. This species is native to regions of southern Africa and thrives in sandy or rocky soils. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal areas.
